[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Iterator direction] Can forward vs backward iterator seeking exploit boundary conditions where (address, version) keys at exact boundaries are skipped, hiding transactions from API clients? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Version gaps] Can version gaps in transaction summaries (due to non-user transactions) cause iterator logic to incorrectly handle boundary cases, skipping legitimate transaction summaries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [IndexedTransactionSummary] [Replay protector bypass] Can an attacker manipulate IndexedTransactionSummary.replay_protector field to bypass sequence number validation, allowing transaction replay attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [IndexedTransactionSummary] [Nonce collision] For orderless transactions using ReplayProtector::Nonce, can nonce collisions in the database index allow an attacker to overwrite transaction summaries and hide transaction history? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [IndexedTransactionSummary] [Sequence number manipulation] Can storing sequence numbers in IndexedTransactionSummary without additional validation allow Byzantine validators to inject fake transaction summaries with arbitrary sequence numbers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Version handling] [Overflow attack] Can version numbers approaching u64::MAX cause wraparound issues in key encoding, potentially causing future transactions to overwrite historical data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Version handling] [Monotonicity violation] Can non-monotonic version numbers be inserted into the schema, breaking the assumption that versions increase sequentially and corrupting transaction ordering? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Version handling] [BigEndian consistency] Is BigEndian encoding of version numbers consistent with how versions are used elsewhere in AptosDB, or can endianness mismatches cause cross-schema inconsistencies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [AccountAddress] [Address validation] Can invalid or malformed AccountAddress values (not exactly 32 bytes) be stored in the schema, causing decode_key() failures that brick database reads? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [AccountAddress] [Special address exploitation] Can system addresses (0x0, 0x1, etc.) be exploited to create transaction summaries that bypass access controls or transaction validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [AccountAddress] [Address collision] Can hash collisions in AccountAddress derivation allow an attacker to query transaction summaries for accounts they don't control? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Cross-schema consistency] [Orphaned summaries] Can transaction summaries exist in TransactionSummariesByAccountSchema without corresponding entries in TransactionSchema, allowing fake transaction claims? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Cross-schema consistency] [Missing summaries] Can transactions exist in TransactionSchema without summaries in TransactionSummariesByAccountSchema, hiding transactions from account queries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Cross-schema consistency] [Version mismatch] Can IndexedTransactionSummary.version differ from the version in the key tuple, causing database corruption and query inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Cross-schema consistency] [Hash mismatch] Can IndexedTransactionSummary.transaction_hash differ from the actual transaction hash in TransactionByHashSchema, allowing transaction forgery? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Cross-schema consistency] [Sender mismatch] Can IndexedTransactionSummary.sender differ from the actual transaction sender, allowing attackers to claim ownership of others' transactions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Database truncation] Can truncating the database to an earlier version leave orphaned transaction summaries with versions beyond the truncation point, causing query inconsistencies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Backup/restore] Does schema encoding/decoding maintain consistency during backup and restore operations, or can version mismatches cause restoration failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Crash recovery] Can interrupted writes to TransactionSummariesByAccountSchema during crashes leave partial keys or values that cause decoding failures on restart? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Memory safety] [Vec allocation] Can encode_key()'s Vec allocation be exploited with carefully crafted AccountAddress lengths to trigger integer overflow in capacity calculations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Memory safety] [Slice access] Can the slice operation &data[AccountAddress::LENGTH..] in decode_key() cause undefined behavior if data length equals AccountAddress::LENGTH? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Resource limits] Can an attacker create millions of transaction summaries for a single account to exhaust storage and make account queries extremely slow? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Concurrent access] Can simultaneous reads and writes to the same (address, version) key cause TOCTOU vulnerabilities where transaction summaries are read in an inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Iterator safety] Can iterators over TransactionSummariesByAccountSchema become invalid during concurrent pruning, causing use-after-free or reading freed memory? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_summaries_by_account/mod.rs] [Batch atomicity] If a SchemaBatch containing multiple TransactionSummariesByAccountSchema entries partially fails, can it leave the database in an inconsistent state? (High)
